thread.title: Meet the 2015 University of Alabama Homecoming Queen
thread.title_full: Meet the 2015 University of Alabama Homecoming Queen

author: Ben Flanagan | bflanagan@al.com
title: Meet the 2015 University of Alabama Homecoming Queen
text:
Comments TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -- With the help of Alabama sports broadcaster and pep rally emcee, the University of Alabama announced Katelyn Katsafanas as its 2015 Homecoming Queen on the steps of Gorgas Library on Friday night. 
A total of 13,329 votes were cast, a much higher total than the 2014 election, which dipped in participation from 2013. 
Sponsored by the Phi Mu sorority, the Naperville, Ill., native is a senior majoring in Finance with a specialization in Professional Sales at the Capstone. 
Katsafanas will be crowned by Alabama Governor Robert Bentley at halftime of the homecoming game between the Crimson Tide and Arkansas Saturday, with kickoff set for 6 p.m. 
The rest of the Alabama Homecoming Court is as follows: 
Katie Baggett (from Brewton, Ala.), a senior majoring in Chemical Engineering, is sponsored by Theta Tau Professional Engineering Fraternity. Her platform is the LiveLovely Foundation. Lauren Beers (from Warren Center, Penn.), a graduate student getting her Masters in Sports Business Management, is sponsored by the Student Athletes Advisory Committee. Her platform is ReadBAMARead. Jasmine Davis (from Atlanta, Ga.), a senior majoring in Business Management, is sponsored by the National Pan-Hellenic Council. Her platform is the Alabama Coalition Against Domestic Violence. Halle Lindsay (from Erie, Penn.), a senior majoring in Psychology and Biology, is sponsored by BLEND. Her platform is Cancer Awareness in conjunction with UA Dance Marathon, UA Relay for Life and UA for St. Jude.
